abstract: General Electric and the Blackstone Group said Thursday that they would buy PHH, a financial-services and mortgage provider, for $31.50 a share, or $1.8 billion. The price represents a 13 percent premium to PHH’s closing stock price of $27.81 on Wednesday. According to the terms of the deal, G.E. Capital will acquire PHH, holding onto the PHH Arval fleet management services unit while selling PHH Mortgage, a residential mortgage servicer, to Blackstone after the transaction closes.
